result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael B Kuester was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to fine. Balance to be paid in 30 days or penalty of 1 day jail, consecutive for non-payment.

Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. 
**  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**
Straight Time. Sentence credit of 9 days were granted. Time Served.
Attend Domestic Violence Counseling if not already attended.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael B Kuester

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael B Kuester in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant was sentenced as follows: Count #1:  JAIL: 9 days jail, apply 9 days credit for TIME SERVED. FINE: $379.00. (apply cash bail)   DNA Surcharge: $200.00. (apply cash bail and balance to be paid in 30 days or serve 1 day jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.) Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. Attend Domestic Violence Counseling if not already attended.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael B Kuester in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.   Penalty enhancer struck by Court upon motion of the State. Court finds defendant guilty. Defense requests another date for sentencing. Court grants request. Conditions of bail addressed. Defense requests bail be modified to no "violent" contact. Court grants request and modifies condition of bail.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Attorney J Anthony Rosario in court.   Defendant Michael B Kuester did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization. Defense is requesting a jury status/jury trial date. State advises they have sent discovery to Defense. Court will give a jury status/trial date.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
